cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba and 165 miles SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba today, then turning north-northwest toward the Florida Keys tonight and tracking along/near Florida’s west coast Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (likely near the Tampa Bay–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – Florida Keys from east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and west coast of Florida from Englewood to Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas; west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (heaviest impacts along west coast), with tropical-storm conditions possible across South Florida including the east-coast metro area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) possible Tuesday into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause brief urban flooding
